skills.name: Calculate the volume of a prism by counting cubes

explanations.A: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in square units?
explanations.B: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.C: This shape is made out of 12 small cubes, so its volume is 12 cubic units.
explanations.D: I think you counted the faces around the outside, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are... How many cubes would you need to build this shape? Try looking at the top face to help you.

explanations.A: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.B: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in square units?
explanations.C: This shape is made out of 12 small cubes, so its volume is 12 cubic units.
explanations.D: I think you counted the faces around the outside, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are... How many cubes would you need to build this shape? Try looking at the top face to help you.

explanations.A: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.B: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in squared units?
explanations.C: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape? Also check your units.
explanations.D: This shape is made out of 7 small cubes, so its volume is 7 cubic units.

explanations.A: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in squared units?
explanations.B: This shape is made out of 9 small cubes, so its volume is 9 cubic units.
explanations.C: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape? Also check your units.
explanations.D: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?

explanations.A: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in squared units?
explanations.B: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.C: Almost, but 9 cubes would make a full 3 x 3 square. This shape has a gap in the middle, so try counting the little cubes again.
explanations.D: This shape is made out of 8 small cubes, each with volume 1 inch cubed, so its volume is 8 inches cubed.

explanations.A: So close but check the units - do we measure volume in squared units?
explanations.B: Almost, but 12 cubes would make a full 3 x 4 rectangle. This shape has a gap in the middle, so try counting the little cubes again.
explanations.C: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.D: This shape is made out of 10 small cubes, each with volume 1 inch cubed, so its volume is 10 inches cubed.

explanations.A: This shape is made up of two layers, with 9 little cubes in each layer. 9 x 2 = 18 ft cubed.
explanations.B: That's the number of cubes in the top layer, but can you see there is another layer underneath? How many cubes will there be in the whole block, if each layer has 9 cubes?
explanations.C: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes, but that gives us surface area, not volume. To find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.D: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?

explanations.A: That's the number of cubes in the top layer, but can you see there are three more layers underneath? How many cubes will there be in the whole block, if each layer has 6 cubes?
explanations.B: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes, but that gives us surface area, not volume. To find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.C: It looks like you counted the faces of the cubes you can see, but to find the volume we want to know how many cubes there are. How many 3D cubes would it take to build this shape?
explanations.D: This shape is made up of two layers, with 12 little cubes in each layer. 12 x 2 = 24 ft cubed.

explanations.A: That's the volume of the shape as it is in the diagram, so what will it be after taking out two of the cubes?
explanations.B: I think you found the surface area of the shape then subtracted two. To find volume we need to know how many 3D cubes are in the shape.
explanations.C: Each layer of the shape measures 4 x 6, so there are 24 cubes in each layer, 48 cubes in total. If we remove two, there will be 46 cubes, so the volume will be 46 inches cubed.
explanations.D: I think you counted faces instead of cubes and then subtracted two. To find volume we need to know how many 3D cubes are in the shape.

explanations.A: I think you counted faces instead of cubes and then subtracted three. To find volume we need to know how many 3D cubes are in the shape.
explanations.B: That's the volume of the shape as it is in the diagram, so what will it be after taking out three of the cubes?
explanations.C: I think you found the surface area of the shape then subtracted three. To find volume we need to know how many 3D cubes are in the shape.
explanations.D: Each layer of the shape measures 2 x 7 and there are 2 layers, so there are 14 x 2 = 28 cubes in total. If we remove three, there will be 25 cubes, so the volume will be 25 inches cubed.
